result.execSummary:
The defendant Loni L Sixt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CASH BOND OF $150.00 APPLIED, leaving a balance of $429.00.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Loni L Sixt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
8:07 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Heath Mynsberge.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with no domestic enhancer with a fine and costs and defense is free to argue.  State concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on the DC and strikes the domestic enhancer.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Mynsberge.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$100 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court orders the $150 cash bond on file be applied to the fine and costs.

Court adjourned at 8:13 a.m.
from Atty Heath Mynsberge dated February 12, 2016 - requests the hearing be rescheduled to a friday

1:35 p.m. No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Heath Mynsberge present via telephone.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Mynsberge - received an offer and needs to talk with the defendant.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on March 8, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:37 p.m.

10:20 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Heath Mynsberge.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Mynsberge - requests another status hearing be scheduled.  Court sets for status hearing on January 19, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.  Atty can appear via telephone.

Court adjourned at 10:22 a.m.
from Atty Heath Mynsberge dated November 17, 2015
and Retainer - By Atty Heath Mynsberge
Warrant letter sent to the defendant - respond on or before November 30, 2015 or warrant will be issued.

9:55 a.m.  No Appearance by the defendant.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders a warrant - stayed for ten days.

Court adjourned at 9:55 a.m.

9:00 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation - cash bond to continue.  Court notes $150.00 cash is on file and orders it to continue.  Court will set for Status Hearing on November 17, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:01 a.m.
